summary: This module provides simple example functions that demonstrate how to use Cython to call C standard library functions for opening files and allocating memory. The functions showcase the use of cimports for fopen, malloc, and free, but they are not referenced elsewhere in the codebase.
business_intent: Educate developers on integrating lowâ€‘level C file handling and memory management into Python code via Cython, serving as a learning example in the user guide.
